ARABIC: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Does not man see that We created him from a drop yet there he is, an open antagonist!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does not man see We created him from a drop of semen? Even then he becomes an open contender,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Has the human being not considered that We have created him from a drop of fluid. He is openly quarrelsome.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And did not man see that We have created him from a drop of semen? Yet he is an open quarreller!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah. Yet behold he (stands forth) as an open opponent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Does not man see that We have created him from the small seed? Then lo! he is an open disputant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Has not man regarded how that We created him of a sperm-drop? Then lo, he is a manifest adversary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed? Yet lo! he is an open opponent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Does not man see that We created him from a drop. Yet there he is, flagrantly contentious,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Beholdest not man that We have created him from a sperm? Yet lo! he is a manifest disputer?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Does not man see that We created him from a drop of [seminal] fluid, and, behold, he is an open contender!?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah (mixed male and female discharge semen drops). Yet behold! He (stands forth) as an open opponent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Has the human not seen how We created him from a drop (of sperm)? Yet he is a clear opponent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Does the human being not consider that We created him from a seed? Yet he becomes a fierce adversary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:77] Or has man — namely, [the like of] al-‘Āsī b. Wā’il — not seen, [has he not] realised, that We created him from a drop, of sperm [and so on in stages] until We made him powerful and strong. Then lo! he is an open adversary, severely antagonistic towards Us, [openly] making this manifest by his denial of resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hath not man seen) does not Ubayy Ibn Khalaf know (that We have created him from a drop of seed) of a weak and stinking sperm drop? (Yet lo! he is an open opponent) he openly argues in falsehood.
